section_title:
14c05 - Storage and local drayage of
household goods.
text:
(a)   Contracts for the carriage or transportation of goods
or personnel must be actually governed by published tariff rates for such
carriage in order for the Section 7(3) exemption to apply. An administrative
exemption has also been provided for certain contracts where such carriage is subject
to Section 10721 of the Interstate Commerce Act. (See 41 U.S.C. 356(3); 29
C.F.R. 4.118, 4.123(d)(3); FOH 14c00(c).) (b)  
The Section 7(3) exemption does
not apply where the principal purpose of the contract is packing, crating,
handling, loading, and/or storage of goods prior to, or following, line-haul
transportation to the ultimate destination. The fact that substantial local
drayage to and from the contractor’s establishment may also be required does
not alter the fact that the principal purpose of such a contract is other than
the carriage of freight. However, if a firm has a separate contract for
transportation subject to a published tariff rate, the Section 7(3) exemption
would apply to that contract. (See 29 C.F.R. 4.118; FOH 14c00(c).)

However, if a firm has a separate contract for transportation subject to a published tariff rate, the Section 7(3) exemption would apply to that contract. (See 29 C.F.R. 4.118; FOH 14c00(c).)
